file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-12-07-04 - GLARESHIELD COVERAGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL GLARESHIELD COVERAGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the glareshield coverage. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 25-12-07-000-801-A GLARESHIELD COVERAGE - REMOVAL GLARESHIELD COVERAGE - INSTALLA- ALL 25-12-07-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-12-07 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-12-07-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. GLARESHIELD COVERAGE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the glareshield coverage. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-09-000-801-A/400 LH/RH COCKPIT LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-24-01-000-801-A/400 - STANDBY ATTITUDE INDICATOR MOUNTING TRAY AMM TASK 34-24-02-000-801-A/400 - REMOVAL AMM TASK 56-11-01-000-801-A/400 COCKPIT EMERGENCY EXIT - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit RH/Cockpit LH I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Remove the standby attitude indicator (AMM TASK 34-24-01-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (3) Remove the mounting tray (AMM TASK 34-24-02-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (4) Remove one of the cockpit emergency exit (AMM TASK 56-11-01-000-801-A/400) to make easier the removal and installation of the glareshield. (5) Remove the front vertical lining panel located at opposite side of the removed cockpit emergency exit ( AMM TASK 25-12-09-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-12-07 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: It is necessary to make easier the removal and installation of the glareshield. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the plugs (2) of the glareshield coverage (1). Refer to DET C, Figures 401 and 402. (2) Loosen the screws (3) that attach the glareshield coverage (1). Refer to DET C, Figures 401 and 402. (3) For aircraft with standby attitude indicator (refer to DET B and DET D, Figure 402), do the steps below: (a) Lift the glareshield coverage (1). (b) Cut the tiedown straps (4) that attach the conditioned air hose (5). (4) Remove the glareshield coverage (1). Refer to DET B, Figures 401 and 402. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-12-07 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH STBY ATTITUDE INDICATOR INSTALLED ON THE TOP OF THE GLARESHIELD PANEL Glareshield Coverage - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A DET. A ZONES 223 224 STANDBY ATTITUDE MOUNTING TRAY 1. GLARESHIELD INDICATOR (REF.) COVERAGE (REF.) D 2. PLUG DET. B C 5. CONDITIONED AIR HOSE 4. TIEDOWN STRAP (2) 3. SCREW DET. C DET. D 145AMM250499.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-12-07 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-12-07-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. GLARESHIELD COVERAGE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the glareshield coverage. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-09-400-801-A/400 LH/RH COCKPIT LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 34-24-01-400-801-A/400 - STANDBY ATTITUDE INDICATOR MOUNTING TRAY AMM TASK 34-24-02-400-801-A/400 - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 56-11-01-400-801-A/400 COCKPIT EMERGENCY EXIT - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit RH/Cockpit LH I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the glareshield coverage (1) in the installation position. Refer to DET B, Figure 401 and Figure 402. NOTE: Make sure that the glareshield coverage (1) is correctly installed along the windshield frame contour and in the attachment points. (2) For aircraft with standby attitude indicator (refer to DET B and DET D, Figure 402), do the step below: (a) Install the tiedown straps (4) that attach the conditioned air hose (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-12-07 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Install the screws (3) and plugs (2) of the glareshield coverage (1). Refer to DET C, Figure 401 and Figure 402. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) If you removed the standby attitude indicator, install it (AMM TASK 34-24-01-400-801- A/400). (2) If you removed the mounting tray, install it (AMM TASK 34-24-02-400-801-A/400). (3) Install the the cockpit emergency exit back (AMM TASK 56-11-01-400-801-A/400). (4) Install the front vertical lining panel back ( AMM TASK 25-12-09-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-12-07 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
